channel.title: Download cache
channel.description:
hello i have started a new server, but when my friend goes to play it just saids downloading cache 0% and it stays there, does anyone know how i can fix it so he can get on.
thank you, shlinky9544

item.title: Download cache
item.dc:creator: @PvP_Bobby PvP Bobby
item.description:
@PvP_Bobby wrote:

Because you didn’t modify the client at all then it seems to me like it is still connecting to 127.0.0.1.

Find the file Client.java and look for 127.0.0.1 and replace that with your IP Address.

ALSO: Make sure your friend has the cache if it is absolutely needed.

Read full topic

item.title: Download cache
item.dc:creator: @shlinky9544 shlinky9544
item.description:
@shlinky9544 wrote:

yes i port forwarded, yes i am useing my ip adress,and i didnt modify the client but i modified the source,

Read full topic

item.title: Download cache
item.dc:creator: @PvP_Bobby PvP Bobby
item.description:
@PvP_Bobby wrote:

So if I understood correctly, you said that you can log on just fine?
That doesn’t really mean much actually… Because the client could just be connecting to “127.0.0.1” Which is the Localhost. The Localhost is – your machine. So of course you can log in.

Few Questions…

  1. Did you port forward 43594?
  2. Are you using your IP address in the client to connect? Meaning did you go into the client and change “127.0.0.1” -> “XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX” <- That being your IP.
  3. Did you modify the client AT ALL?

Read full topic

item.title: Download cache
item.dc:creator: @shlinky9544 shlinky9544
item.description:
@shlinky9544 wrote:

my ip is correct, i chech the status of the server and it is online, i made it threw rsps coding, and i can logg on fine, would my friend have to go download the cache from this site or what do i need to do, because i didnt really understand the first thing you said

Read full topic

item.title: Download cache
item.dc:creator: @PvP_Bobby PvP Bobby
item.description:
@PvP_Bobby wrote:

This could be a few different reasons…
1. Is the cache location in the client specifying an outside location? (perhaps a website or something along those lines)
Sometimes people will make the client look towards a website or another location in order to get the cache downloaded.

2. Does the client automatically download the cache as you need it rather than the whole thing?
If this is the case then you should check out if the client is even connecting to the server correctly.
You should also check to see if the server is being hosted properly (open ports/live connection/etc…)
You should also check to see if the client is connecting to your server’s ip address

Read full topic
